Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide -- HRC Amendment - Re. Legislative Employees
Race.SummaryText:
CHARTER AMENDMENT PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  AMENDMENT TO THE CURRENT HOME RULE CHARTER OF THE PARISH OF LAFOURCHE, STATE OF LOUISIANA, AS IT PERTAINS TO CLASSIFIED LEGISLATIVE EMPLOYEES, LEGISLATIVE CUSTODIAN OF RECORDS, AND TERMS OF OFFICE FOR COUNCIL CLERK AND INTERNAL AUDITOR AND ENACTING CERTAIN OTHER PROVISIONS IN CONNECTION THEREWITH.
Race.FullText:
Shall Article III Organization, Structure and Distribution of Powers and Functions, Section 2 The Legislative Branch, J. Legislative Employees, Paragraphs 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 (Page 5) state:

"1. Council Clerk
The Council shall appoint a Council Clerk by resolution. The Clerk shall give notice of Council meetings to its members and the public, keep the minutes of its proceedings, be official secretary of the Council and Custodian of Records for the Legislative Branch, and perform such other duties as are assigned to the office by this Charter or by the Council. The Council may remove the Clerk by a resolution adopted by a favorable two-thirds (2/3) vote of at least six (6) of its voting members.

2. Council Internal Auditor
The Council may appoint an Internal Auditor by resolution. The Internal Auditor shall be responsible for reporting to the Council on budgetary and financial matters relating to the Parish and perform such other duties as are assigned to the office by the Council. The Council may remove the Internal Auditor by a resolution adopted by a favorable two-thirds (2/3) vote of at least six (6) of its voting members.

3. Council Employees
The Council may hire or remove any unclassified clerical employees that may be necessary to assist the Council Clerk and Internal Auditor in carrying out their duties. If a Council clerical employee is determined by ordinance to be classified, the Council Clerk shall appoint or dismiss the employee as provided for in the Civil Service Rules and Regulations.

4. Terms of Employment of Council Employees
All unclassified Council employees shall serve at the pleasure of the Council.

5. Salaries of Council Employees
The Council shall fix the salaries of all unclassified Council employees by ordinance, unless the salary or salaries previously have been fixed in the operating budget. The salaries of all classified Council employees shall be fixed by the Council Clerk as provided for in the Civil Service Rules and Regulations"

and shall C be added to Article IV Civil Service Department, Section 3 Appointment and Dismissal of Parish Civil Service Employees, (Page 14), said paragraph C to read as follows:

"C. All appointments and dismissals of classified employees in the Legislative Branch of the Parish shall be made by the Council Clerk as provided for in the Civil Service Rules and Regulations."?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Golden Meadow -- Prop.#1-5.09 Mill-Mayor/Council Levees-10 Yrs
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1
(MILLAGE CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 5.09 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION FOR MAINTAINING LEVEES IN THE TOWN.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a special tax of five and nine hundredths (5.09) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $36,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of maintaining levees in the Town of Golden Meadow?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Golden Meadow -- Prop.#2-5.09 Mill-Mayor/Council Drainage 10Yr
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2
(MILLAGE CONTINUATION)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 5.09 MILLS PROPERTY TAX CONTINUATION FOR MAINTAINING DRAINAGE WORKS IN THE TOWN.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a special tax of five and nine hundredths (5.09) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Town (an estimated $36,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of maintaining drainage works in the Town of Golden Meadow?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation Dist. No. 11 -- 4.73 Mill - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 11 PROPOSITION
(RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 4.73 MILLS PROPERTY TAX RENEWAL FOR CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, IMPROVING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN AND FOR RECREATION DISTRICT NO. 11.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 11 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a four and seventy three-hundredths (4.73) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $67,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of constructing, acquiring, improving, maintaining and operating recreational facilities in and for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: N.Lafx Consv., Levee/Drn. -- 7 Mill - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
NORTH LAFOURCHE CONSERVATION, LEVEE AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT PROPOSITION
(MILLAGE RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 7 MILLS PROPERTY TAX RENEWAL FOR NORTH LAFOURCHE CONSERVATION, LEVEE AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT, FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSTRUCTING AND MAINTAINING NECESSARY LEVEES, LEVEE DRAINAGE, FLOOD PROTECTION, HURRICANE FLOOD PROTECTION AND FOR ALL OTHER PURPOSES INCIDENTAL THERETO.
Race.FullText: Shall North Lafourche Conservation, Levee and Drainage District (the "District") be authorized to levy a special tax of seven (7) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018 (an estimated $1,260,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of constructing and maintaining necessary levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection and for all other purposes incidental thereto?
